conclusion: The vertical axis shows velocity in m/s^-1 and the horizontal axis shows time in seconds.
The graph shows the skydiver's vertical velocity over time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, and on a v-t graph, acceleration corresponds to the slope of the curve.
Positive slope indicates positive acceleration, negative slope indicates negative acceleration, and zero slope indicates zero acceleration.
At t = 0, velocity is 0 m/s and the velocity increases in a curved manner reaching approximately 20 m/s at t = 10.
The slope of the curve during the 0-10 seconds interval is always positive but gradually decreases.
Positive velocity means downward motion (falling) and the skydiver starts from rest.
For vertical motion near Earth's surface, acceleration due to gravity points downward and drag force from air resistance points upward.
Since the slope of the v-t graph is positive throughout the 0-10 second interval, the acceleration is positive.
Positive acceleration means the acceleration is in the downward direction (same as the velocity).
The curved shape of the line indicates that the magnitude of the acceleration is decreasing over time, consistent with air resistance increasing as velocity increases.
During the 0-10 seconds interval, the acceleration is in the downward direction (positive in this coordinate system).
